page.title: 13Newquay's views on Violence
page.content:
After the terrifying events at the European Cup Final in Brussels,concern was expressed over football violence.A survey was conducted to discover how people felt.Our results were not conclusive,but interesting.Out of the hundred people interviewed,48 came from Cornwall.53 men and 42 women took part-some couldn't decide!
Alcohol was thought to be the main cause(80),but some who thought so, didn't think it should be banned,and some who didn't thought it should be!
A majority were against electric fences(67),but for ID cards(55) and having all-ticket matches(72).More men than women wanted electric fences and less women than men were against the World Cup ban.More men(20_11) thought that unemployment was a factor.
